article.headline: Alabama 69, Louisiana Tech 63
article.story: TUSCALOOSA, Ala. (AP) -- Kennedy Winston scored 24 points, including four free throws in the final 10 seconds, to help Alabama defeat Louisiana Tech 69-63 on Friday night, giving coach Mark Gottfried his 100th win with the Crimson Tide. Chuck Davis added 10 points and 11 rebounds for the Tide (1-1), which improved to 36-1 in home openers at Coleman Coliseum. Donell Allick led the Bulldogs (0-1) with 19 points. Corey Dean added 17 points, and Paul Millsap had 10 points and nine rebounds before fouling out with 6:42 left in the game. The Bulldogs were only 6-of-12 from the free-throw line, but they sent Alabama to the line 32 times. The Tide took advantage by sinking 26 foul shots, none bigger than the four Winston hit at the end. After trailing by as many as eight in the second half, the Bulldogs crept back. Barry Thompson completed a three-point play with 27 seconds to play to pull Tech to within 62-61. The teams exchanged free throws, but Winston iced the game with his four foul shots. Neither team was particularly sharp -- Alabama made only 33.3 percent of its shots and committed 12 turnovers, while the Bulldogs hit 44.6 percent but turned the ball over 19 times.
